solution_line_template: Two dozens of pencils are equal to {num_dozen} x {pencils_per_dozen} = <<{num_dozen}*{pencils_per_dozen}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} pencils.
So the total cost of pencils is ${pencil_cost} x {total_pencils} = $<<{pencil_cost}*{total_pencils}={total_pencil_cost}>>{total_pencil_cost}.
The total cost of folders is ${folder_cost} x {num_folders} = $<<{folder_cost}*{num_folders}={total_folder_cost}>>{total_folder_cost}.
Thus, the cost to buy the office supplies is ${total_pencil_cost} + ${total_folder_cost} = $<<{total_pencil_cost}+{total_folder_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
